predicate.note: Frames file for 'suspect' based on sentences in financial subcorpus. No access to verbnet. No comparison.

roleset.name: have a suspicion about something

example.name: just transitive
example.text: Mark Shepperd, an analyst at UBS Phillips & Drew in London, said, ``I suspect (the departure) will be fairly irrelevant for the company.
example.arg: (the departure) will be fairly irrelevant for the company

example.name: passive extraction
example.text: Those employees are suspected *trace* of illegally gaining an estimated $376.8 million, the prosecutor was quoted as saying by the Excelsior news service.

roleset.note: Note how extracting the subject of the embedded sentence forces the embedded sentence itself to be introduced by a preposition.

example.name: another prepositional example
example.text: Mary suspects nothing but evil intentions of John.
